channel.title: Ultimate Way to Get Ownage Marks
channel.description:
There is only 1 true way. Listening in class, asking your teacher questions and studying.
Ofcourse you dont always have your teacher on handy other option is using google. Im willing to help people in here. I like maths post any math questions here, and others i suppose. Maths <3

item.title: Ultimate Way to Get Ownage Marks
item.dc:creator: @cant_touch_this93 cant touch this93
item.description:
@cant_touch_this93 wrote:

[quote=“BobDole81, post:5, topic:125321”]In my view, unless you have some kind of documented learning disability, all you need is some kind of motivation to learn. When in a classroom, good teachers are essential to stimulating a desire to learn in the students. But if you wish to succeed yourself and you want to learn, you can. [/quote] My parents dont go for that. I has dyslexia , so on test and such i usealy do quite horible , but i know the material. They say that my dyslexia is no excuse for getting a c or d etc. The way to impress our teachers it to atleast seem like you care. If you have a good attitude about things and dont slack off, they’ll usealy not be so harsh when they grade you.

Read full topic
item.source: Ultimate Way to Get Ownage Marks

item.title: Ultimate Way to Get Ownage Marks
item.dc:creator: @Mattymat1313 Mattymat1313
item.description:
@Mattymat1313 wrote:

reading is my most horrible subject. even though i am a fluent reader i sometimes cant get into the story at all. no matter how hard and how many times i read the story. but in math i totally understand it all cause its soo simple to me =D. i got 85% on my SAT called the ISAT in math. w00t

Read full topic
item.source: Ultimate Way to Get Ownage Marks

item.title: Ultimate Way to Get Ownage Marks
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

There are also kids that learn better without someone teaching them. So not everyone needs a teacher.

Read full topic
item.source: Ultimate Way to Get Ownage Marks

item.title: Ultimate Way to Get Ownage Marks
item.dc:creator: @moparsc4p3 moparsc4p3
item.description:
@moparsc4p3 wrote:

[quote=“BobDole81, post:3, topic:125321”]Yay, another math lover

But that’s not guaranteed to work all the time…I’ve had teachers back in early high school who used to stomp their foot whenever something was likely to come up on the test. And I’ve also had teachers who hate giving A’s…one of my US History teachers gave most of the class 89%'s on our essays, just so he could give the impression of the course being difficult. I managed to get an A at the end because the final was mostly multiple choice, but there are crazy teachers out there.

Generally, you’re right though. If you put the time into it, there’s really no reason you shouldn’t do well.[/quote]

Lol I had a teacher in 6th grade which was so stupid she couldn’t speak english.
Some schools are desperate for teachers…

Read full topic
item.source: Ultimate Way to Get Ownage Marks

item.title: Ultimate Way to Get Ownage Marks
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

BobDole81:

In my view, unless you have some kind of documented learning disability, all you need is some kind of motivation to learn. When in a classroom, good teachers are essential to stimulating a desire to learn in the students. But if you wish to succeed yourself and you want to learn, you can.

Thats true. I don’t think time is the crucial factor.

Read full topic
item.source: Ultimate Way to Get Ownage Marks

In my view, unless you have some kind of documented learning disability, all you need is some kind of motivation to learn. When in a classroom, good teachers are essential to stimulating a desire to learn in the students. But if you wish to succeed yourself and you want to learn, you can.

item.title: Ultimate Way to Get Ownage Marks

@xxlegitxx wrote:

BobDole81:

Generally, you’re right though. If you put the time into it, there’s really no reason you shouldn’t do well.

Unless you’re stupid.

item.title: Ultimate Way to Get Ownage Marks
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

Yay, another math lover

But that’s not guaranteed to work all the time…I’ve had teachers back in early high school who used to stomp their foot whenever something was likely to come up on the test. And I’ve also had teachers who hate giving A’s…one of my US History teachers gave most of the class 89%'s on our essays, just so he could give the impression of the course being difficult. I managed to get an A at the end because the final was mostly multiple choice, but there are crazy teachers out there.

Generally, you’re right though. If you put the time into it, there’s really no reason you shouldn’t do well.
